alert.note: Alert for Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 09 at 10:17PM CDT until June 09 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN TOM GREEN COUNTY INCLUDING THE CITY OF SAN ANGELO... At 1012 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain from Harriet to Wall and Vancourt to 10 miles south of Vancourt, moving east at 25 mph. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the city of San Angelo, and 2 to 3 1/2 inches from Grape Creek to 10 miles southwest of Grape Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.25 inches are possible in the warned area, east of the city of San Angelo. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Angelo, Goodfellow Air Force Base, O.c. Fisher Reservoir, Lake Nasworthy, San Angelo State Park, Wall, Veribest, Grape Creek and Harriet. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... College Hills and Millbrook, Howard and Webster, Jackson From Knickerbocker to South Bryant, Southwest Blvd and Loop 306, FM 2334 crossing Dry Lipan Creek, Sul Ross At Red Arroyo Crossing, Huntington and Sunset, FM 2334 crossing Ninemile Creek, FM 1692 crossing Sales Branch and Huntington and Sunset. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
